metadata.title: CVE-2024-24815 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description: CKEditor4 is an open source what-you-see-is-what-you-get HTML editor. Across-site scripting vulnerability has been discovered in the core HTMLparsing module in versions of CKEditor4 prior to 4.24.0-lts. It may affectall editor instances that enabled full-page editing mode or enabled CDATAelements in Advanced Content Filtering configuration (defaults to `script`and `style` elements). The vulnerability allows attackers to injectmalformed HTML content bypassing Advanced Content Filtering mechanism,which could result in executing JavaScript code. An attacker could abusefaulty CDATA content detection and use it to prepare an intentional attackon the editor. A fix is available in version 4.24.0-lts.

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
ckeditor3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
ldap-account-manager package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
request-tracker4 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
